posts.name: Nick Tahou Hots
posts.note: Nick Tahou Hots is a Rochester, NY landmark restaurant famous for its Garbage Plate. The restaurant was founded by its namesake, Nick Tahou. Despite many regional variants all based on the same theme, Nick's is widely regarded as the original Garbage Plate which usually contain a mash-up of meats (hamburgers, cheese burgers, hot dogs, etc.), fries, salads and sauces. NOTE: My New York State Trooper friends would go in uniform after dropping people at Rochester's main police staion.

posts.name: Mamasan's Noodle Caboodle Restaurant
posts.note: Hearty Thai and Vietnamese noodle and rice dishes spiced to taste in a friendly, family-run eatery. They have great Thai and Vietnamese food and I never ordered a bad dish there.

posts.name: Parkside Diner
posts.note: Classic, unpretentious American restaurant with outdoor seating and an attached mini-golf course. I love ordering their create your own omelette with artichokes and sauteed mushrooms, hash browns, and a side of country toast.
